intro: Bursa djurdjurae, commonly known as the Djurdjura bur, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are compound, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
